long_desc.thetext: Description of problem: Months ago MRBS 1.5 has been released. We could test it on Fedora 24

Current version 1.4.10 is pretty old and use some pear libraries which are probably dead (php-pear-Mail, php-pear-Net-SMTP, php-pear-Net-Socket)
Especially with upcoming PHP 7, nice to update and check everything can work.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
mrbs-1.5.0-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-7c1fb7b969

mrbs-1.5.0-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-54f4890eaf

mrbs-1.5.0-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-c94dd37ffc

could you please stop posting updates on this bugreport? 1.5 has been released and obsoleted by 1.6 (released it too on Fedora repos) and I am no longer interested in receiving updates from MRBS, moreover I am not able to remove my self from this bugreport. Thx

(In reply to Germano Massullo from comment #32) > [...]and I am no longer interested in receiving updates from MRBS[...]
I meant
[...]and I am no longer interested in receiving updates from this MRBS bugreport[...]
